website_summaries.verdict: Although the Inov-8 Race Ultra 290 was successful in delivering a comfortable and breathable ride, it still received negative feedback from users. Some runners thought it was too narrow, heavy and expensive. Despite the negative comments, some runners still consider the shoe as a great addition to their collection. The Race Ultra 290 offers moderate stability, durable components and responsive performance for everyday training.
pros: A soft mesh and some synthetic materials make a comfortable and breathable upper unit based on the remarks of several runners
Most reviewers appreciated the attachment tabs on the upper for gaiters, which offer more protection against dirt and other debris
Runners generally welcomed the anti-microbial treatment given to the Ultra 290 because it keeps the interior environment healthy
The Meta-Shank Generation III delivers flexibility and impact protection for the forefoot area
Sticky rubber in the outsole area ensures durable protection and traction that’s needed for racing, according to a few testers
cons: Some runners felt that the Race Ultra 290 was a bit narrow in the forefoot area
Others weren’t impressed by the midsole, which to them was mostly stiff in the midfoot and heel areas
A few thought that it was a bit too heavy for their feet

customer_reviews.title: Great for running dog agility in a dirt arena
customer_reviews.text: These are my "go to" shoes for my sport of dog agility. I use these when I want good traction, in particular when running on dirt or bark. They provide excellent traction without too much tread like some trail shoes. I can still pivot and turn easily. The bonus is that while these are not waterproof, they are also not an open mesh, so I don't end up with socks full of dirt and dust at the end of a day.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia L.

customer_reviews.title: I wore the shoes running up hilly / wet / muddy trails and got a terrible blister on ankle and under foot
customer_reviews.text: I bought for trail running and a spartan race. I wore the shoes running up hilly / wet / muddy trails and got a terrible blister on ankle and under foot. Water stayed in the shoe and running mate told me she could hear the water sloshing around when we ran. The shoes were a little wider than I expected. I will wear around but not for trail running.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M Whitacre

customer_reviews.title: Just a bit smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Fit is okay, I bought them for running and went with a 6 1/2 which is my running shoe size, but I am afraid with long suns and feet swelling they may not have enough room and I have never worn a size 7 before. so even though they feel extremely comfortable they do run smaller than my other brands of shoes, but wanted to give them a try due to high reviews...So I do recommend got up an additional 1/2 size if your a runner.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara pacheco

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my recent trip to Las Vegas. We planned on doing some hiking and I didn't have appropriate footwear. These were amazing! I normally have to use custom orthotics in my footwear because of my arthritis and fibromyalgia. I had no back or neck pain after hiking these in for 3 days. I highly recommend these shoes. They are super comfortable and they breathe so no sweaty feet.
customer_reviews.author: Vplatania1967

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, wide toe shoe - Sturdy build
customer_reviews.text: Very nice fit. Wide toe leaves plenty of room for a thicker sock. I tend to use these for everyday use in the winter because of their rugged-ness on all types of surfaces, including snow. After 1 year of use, I have a small tear in the toe box but would buy this brand again because of the comfort. I just found them a bit bulky but it works for me in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Marz

customer_reviews.title: ... to use for the Spartan race and she absolutely loved it! She has a medium to high arch ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Inov-8s for my girlfriend to use for the Spartan race and she absolutely loved it! She has a medium to high arch and she's a little wide footed, but the shoes fit comfortably. The only issues she had was actually breaking them in. Once they were a little worn-in the shoes gave her great support during the run and even on the obstacles. The fact that they were light-weight helped here manage a pretty intense pace throughout the race. I would recommend these shoes for Spartan or tough mudder races.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, im an avid asics wearer
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe ,im an avid asics wearer ,not quite as cusioned as my asics but a good shoe works awsome for trail wearing without my feet getting wet in less favorable conditions .i found the shoe fit true to size not small like alot of the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: melanie g

customer_reviews.title: Order a full size up.
customer_reviews.text: They run super small. I normally wear a 7.5 and so I ordered 7.5s but they were too small so I ordered 8s and they didn't feel much better so I ordered for a third time 8.5s and they fit great. It was a pain in the butt to get them, but they're a great price and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sneaker/hikers! Wish I had these years ago
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sneaker/hikers! Wish I had these years ago! I run/hike in the desert, up hills and through cactus and sharp rocks! They have amazing grip and tough enough soles so I don't feel the rocks in my feet!! Love these shoes
customer_reviews.author: Amountain

customer_reviews.title: Good tread, but lots of blisters on 1st wear, needs breaking in
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 5.5 in heels and a 6.5 or 7 in running shoes. Bought these in a 7 and they appeared to fit. Did a 12 mile hike today and I have 3 monster blisters. Hoping they get better as they break in. I thought the tread was really good. Solid grip on climbs and slippery rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. I like Inov8
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I like Inov8. Have had a couple pairs in the past. Bought these for hiking and dog walking. The soles have a nice grip. Toe box shaped is nice and wide and doesn't force your toes into some weird narrow shape. Color scheme is pretty neat too :)
customer_reviews.author: mnk

customer_reviews.title: Hike 700 miles in these through desert, mountain and ...
customer_reviews.text: Hike 700 miles in these through desert, mountain and volcanic terrain and they only tore on the toebox in the last 100 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... sneakers almost every day since they arrived and I love them. The first day I wore them there ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these sneakers almost every day since they arrived and I love them. The first day I wore them there was some snow on the ground, my feet remained dry!
customer_reviews.author: EGC

customer_reviews.title: Great grip!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes! I don't recommend them for walking around town, but they're the best and most grippy trail shoes I've owned!
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved these for a mud run- drained well and not too heavy, but supportive
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: I bought an 8 but I believe they were more like a Ladies size 6
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the product runs very small. Had to return them and do with another brand shoe. I personally think they were wrongly sized. I bought an 8 but I believe they were more like a Ladies size 6. They seemed like a good shoe just a very small make.
customer_reviews.author: LSJ

customer_reviews.title: returned. Did not have the footbed that promotes proper ...
customer_reviews.text: returned. Did not have the footbed that promotes proper position for my back. looking for more support and less rise in heel.
customer_reviews.author: tt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing! They fit very comfortably and give me support while allowing my feet to breathe. They are snug but not too tight. I had stepped on a toothpick the day before getting these shoes. It really hurt to walk, but I had to partake in an event the next day that required a lot of walking. These shoes saved the day! I had heard about Inov-8 from a fellow fitness friend, who had highly recommended them. I had been waiting for over a year to purchase the shoes because of how expensive they are. When they went on a lightening deal, it was a no brainer! Worth the wait!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Marshall

customer_reviews.title: They are nice, but run a bit small
customer_reviews.text: Just received my item. They are nice, but run a bit small. I am usually an 8.5, but in these shoes my toe hits the front of the shoe. Exchanging for a 9.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm a true women's 61/2 and these shoes fit my niece who wears a women's 5 1/2- 6.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love them but do fit small. So buy at least half size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great tread! Fit perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great tread! Fit perfect. I like the loop on the back to help slip them on. Comfortable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Adam

customer_reviews.title: great shoe for a Spartan Race
customer_reviews.text: great shoe for a Spartan Race. They dried pretty quickly, kept traction, and I didn't blister. I use these for most trail runs nowadays and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Geraghty

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! They fit perfectly and are so comfortable. There was no "breaking in". They felt great from day one. I will definitely be purchasing this brand of shoes again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: sole of shoe has very good tread for trails and traction
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, sole of shoe has very good tread for trails and traction. The shoe lacks overall cushion and flexibility when trail running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love theese. Looking forward to running an upcoming OCR ...
customer_reviews.text: Love theese. Looking forward to running an upcoming OCR in them. So happy with the fit and the price. Could not ask for more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feet Stay Dry
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy. They can stand up to the morning dew without wetting through.
customer_reviews.author: Kyra Z. Duran

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes! They fit even better than I expected. My feet are slightly wide, so I was worried to buy shoes on-line. They have extremely good support, are comfortable and breath well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Pook

customer_reviews.title: Best lightweight comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love Innov8. Comfortable to wear immediately. I can do 50kms plus in these shoes without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Bottrell

customer_reviews.title: good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like good shoes, just didn't fit and will order a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: bikerlulu

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: My heels were slipping in these shoes so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Rudor M. Teich

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes!! They fit very well and are always comfortable on my 7-8 mile walks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I tried them so I know that Inov8 isn't ...
customer_reviews.text: My toes hit the front of the shoe, so I had to return them. I'm glad I tried them so I know that Inov8 isn't for me. For comparison, I've had very good luck with Brooks Glycerin, Asics, and now usually buy Salomon Speedcross and Salomon XMission. New Balance never works for me. I only give a comparison of brands so perhaps those of you who have luck with the same shoes that work for me will have an idea of whether these will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Initial Review-Not Run in Yet
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars so far. Haven't run in them yet. Like the roomy toe box. I did feel my heel was sliding around so I opted not to run in them yet & need to adjust laces.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I just didn't like the way they fit and feel.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes and very well made. My only reservation is if you have a second toe bigger than your big toe, it's a bit short. After several hikes, they are lightweight and my legs and feet don't hurt after. We walk/ jog trails daily and they grip the trail and rocks well.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Rush

customer_reviews.title: so not the best person to give this review
customer_reviews.text: I guess it's an ok running shoe for the price. Nevertheless, I m not really a runner, so not the best person to give this review.
customer_reviews.author: Rsan

product_meta.title: inov-8 Women's Race Ultra 290 Sneaker
product_meta.description: The ultimate shoe for running limitless miles over hard pack trails, the award-winning Race Ultra series brings comfort, protection, grip and debris-free running with intergrated gaiter options (gaiter sold separately). Increased levels of protection and underfoot cushioning make the 290 perfect for long distance training and racing. With outstanding comfort, durability and grip, this shoe delivers an ultra-comfortable ride through its injected midsole.
feature_bullets: Trail running shoe with mesh and TPU upper featuring GORE-TEX waterproof membrane
